intro: Morelosia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils or open areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
